exchangeRate

Class CalculatorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • exchangeRate.CalculatorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Calculator

    public class CalculatorImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Calculator
    Calculator converts in between two provided currencies as specified in the provided exchange rate.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double convert(Currencies from, Currencies to, double amount)
      Converts a provided amount in currency "from" to an amount in currency "to"

      Creates a currency calculator which converts in between currencies "first" and "second" at the specified rate.

      Merges a given Calculator "other" with the Calculator on which the method is called.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Calculator create(Currencies first,
                Currencies second,
                double rate)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a currency calculator which converts in between currencies "first" and "second" at the specified rate.
        Parameters:
        first - the first currency this calculator accepts.
        second - the second currency this calculator accepts; must never be equal to first currency.
        rate - the exchange rate to convert from first currency to second; must be a non-zero positive number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown when rate is a negative number or zero, or first and second currencies are equal.

      • convert

        public double convert(Currencies from,
             Currencies to,
             double amount)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Calculator
        Converts a provided amount in currency "from" to an amount in currency "to"
        Specified by:
        convert in interface Calculator
        Parameters:
        from - the currency to convert from
        to - the currency to convert to
        amount - the amount to convert; must be a positive number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown when amount is a negative number, when first and second currencies are equal or when a different currency as in create() is provided .

      • merge

        public Calculator merge(Calculator other)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: Calculator
        Merges a given Calculator "other" with the Calculator on which the method is called.
        Specified by:
        merge in interface Calculator
        Parameters:
        other - the other calculator
        Returns:
        the merged Calculator
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown when other is null, or other is the Calculator on which the method is called.
